intro: Calantica capuronii, commonly known as the Capuron's calantica, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
